title: Why is ketchup so hard to pour? - George Zaidan

multiple-choice.question: What type of fluid is ketchup classified as, and how does it respond to force?

options.label: A
options.text: Newtonian fluid, responding to force linearly

options.label: B
options.text: Non-Newtonian fluid, responding to force non-linearly

options.label: C
options.text: Viscous fluid, responding to force with a constant viscosity

options.label: D
options.text: Elastic fluid, responding to force with a fixed shape

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between Newtonian and Non-Newtonian fluids?

options.label: A
options.text: Newtonian fluids are thicker, while Non-Newtonian fluids are thinner

options.label: B
options.text: Newtonian fluids respond to force linearly, while Non-Newtonian fluids respond non-linearly

options.label: C
options.text: Newtonian fluids are more common in nature, while Non-Newtonian fluids are more common in manufactured products

options.label: D
options.text: Newtonian fluids have a fixed viscosity, while Non-Newtonian fluids have a variable viscosity

multiple-choice.question: What happens to ketchup particles when a weak force is applied quickly?

options.label: A
options.text: They flow easily past each other

options.label: B
options.text: They become thicker and more resistant to flow

options.label: C
options.text: They bump into each other, but can't get out of each other's way, so the ketchup doesn't flow

options.label: D
options.text: They change shape and become more fluid

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what are two methods to get ketchup out of the bottle?

options.label: A
options.text: Apply a weak force for a short time, or apply a strong force for a short time

options.label: B
options.text: Apply a weak force for a long time, or apply a strong force for a short time

options.label: C
options.text: Give the bottle a series of long, slow shakes, or hit the bottle once very hard

options.label: D
options.text: Give the bottle a few short, sharp shakes with the lid on, then pour, or give the bottle a series of long, slow shakes

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of xanthan gum in ketchup?
According to scientists, what are two possible ways ketchup particles behave when a weak force is applied for a long time?

options.label: A
options.text: They bump into each other and can't get out of each other's way

options.label: B
options.text: They slowly get bumped towards the middle, leaving a lubricant near the edges

options.label: C
options.text: They rearrange themselves into lots of small groups, which then flow past each other

options.label: D
options.text: Both B and C are possible

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a substance that exhibits the opposite behavior of ketchup when force is applied?
Why is ketchup considered a complicated mixture from a physics perspective?

options.label: C
options.text: Because it has a balance of ingredients and natural thickeners that affect its behavior

multiple-choice.question: According to the "real pros," what is the most effective method for pouring ketchup?

options.label: A
options.text: Give the bottle a few short, sharp shakes with the lid on, then pour

options.label: B
options.text: Give the bottle a series of long, slow shakes and then pour

options.label: C
options.text: Hit the bottle once very hard and then pour

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why ketchup can be challenging to pour?

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's a Non-Newtonian fluid that responds to force non-linearly

options.label: D
options.text: Because the bottle is too small
